meanings.definition: relating to or functioning as an adverb
meanings.sent1: The adverbial word 'quickly' describes how fast something happens.
meanings.sent2: She used an adverbial phrase to modify the verb in the sentence.
meanings.sent3: The adverbial squirrel climbed the tree with great agility.
meanings.sent4: Her adverbial skills in writing made her stories come alive.
meanings.sent5: The adverbial nature of his speech added depth to his storytelling.

meanings.definition: expressing manner, place, time, frequency, degree, or cause
meanings.sent1: He ran adverbially fast to catch the bus.
meanings.sent2: She placed the book adverbially on the shelf.
meanings.sent3: The cat meowed adverbially at the door, wanting to go outside.
meanings.sent4: The music flowed adverbially through the room, filling it with joy.
meanings.sent5: The rain fell adverbially, creating a soothing sound on the roof.
